hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Liquidity Drain
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL-to-BEAR transitions, when aggregate exchange stablecoin reserves drop >5% over 5 days while funding rates remain positive (>0.005% daily), a sharp 7-10% correction occurs within 96 hours as leverage unwinds without supportive liquidity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Positive funding with declining stablecoin reserves indicates leveraged longs building into deteriorating liquidity conditions. This creates fragile positioning that unwinds sharply when regime confirms bearish.
entry_conditions: Regime shift from NEUTRAL to BEAR detected (confidence >60%)
Aggregate stablecoin reserves decline >5% over 5 days
Perp funding rates remain positive (>0.005% daily)
Open interest increases >10% during stablecoin decline

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Stablecoin reserves reverse trend (increase >2%) or funding turns negative

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fails to drop >5% within 96 hours in >35% of cases meeting all entry conditions
